info.name: Odoo API Collection
info.description:
Basic endpoints for integration with online selling platforms.
Note, that for information purposes only some fields available in Odoo are included in the example responses. It's a configurable thing in Odoo to select what fields you'd like to see in API.

Although, we've left all the fields available in the sample response for GET invoice - so you can see there is a lot of information possible to include if needed. Also, any other fields could be created: as static db fields, as computed "function" fields, key:value dynamic fields.

Note that URLs and auth tokens used in this collection are from a local environment.
By requrest, we can provide details for our demo Odoo instance, where it'd be possible to have a go with the working version of API.

request.description: Login endpoint: exchange a permanent token for a temporary auth token

Get a list of product categories.
Note: parent_id field determines parent/child relationship.
Optional domain parameter is added to show how you could filter by parent.

header.value: Content-Type, Accept, Access-Token, access_token, Origin, X-Requested-With

response.name: GET Products - response when model is not enabled in Odoo API (configurable by Odoo admin users)

header.value: Content-Type, Accept, Access-Token, access_token, Origin, X-Requested-With

request.description: POST with a minimum set of requirements. A lot of other fields could be added if required - basically everything except fields that are computed in the background of Odoo.

Note a lot of fields for invoice lines - as an example of a lot of potential fields that could be added.
Type out_invoice is to filter for customer invoices.
